dataset: Ever Forest Derived from Annual National Land Cover Database (NLCD) Collection 1 Products (ver. 1.1, June 2025)

classes.label: Open Water
classes.description: Areas of open water, generally with less than 25% cover of vegetation or soil.

classes.label: Perennial Ice/Snow
classes.description: Areas characterized by a perennial cover of ice and/or snow, generally greater than 25% of total cover.

classes.label: Developed, Open Space
classes.description: Areas with a mixture of some constructed materials, but mostly vegetation in the form of lawn grasses. Impervious surfaces account for <20% of total cover. Often large-lot single-family housing, parks, golf courses, or landscaped areas.

classes.label: Developed, Low Intensity
classes.description: Areas with a mixture of constructed materials and vegetation. Impervious surfaces account for 20–49% of total cover. Commonly single-family housing.

classes.label: Developed, Medium Intensity
classes.description: Areas with a mixture of constructed materials and vegetation. Impervious surfaces account for 50–79% of total cover. Often single-family housing.

classes.label: Developed, High Intensity
classes.description: Highly developed areas where people reside or work in high numbers (e.g., apartments, row houses, commercial/industrial). Impervious surfaces account for 80–100% of total cover.

classes.label: Barren Land (Rock/Sand/Clay)
classes.description: Areas of bedrock, desert pavement, scarps, talus, slides, volcanic material, glacial debris, sand dunes, strip mines, gravel pits and other accumulations of earthen material. Vegetation generally <15% of total cover.

classes.label: Deciduous Forest
classes.description: Areas dominated by trees generally >5 m tall and >20% vegetation cover. >75% of tree species shed foliage simultaneously in response to seasonal change.

classes.label: Evergreen Forest
classes.description: Areas dominated by trees generally >5 m tall and >20% vegetation cover. >75% of tree species maintain leaves year-round; canopy is never without green foliage.

classes.label: Mixed Forest
classes.description: Areas dominated by trees generally >5 m tall and >20% vegetation cover. Neither deciduous nor evergreen species exceed 75% of total tree cover.

classes.label: Dwarf Scrub
classes.description: Alaska only: areas dominated by shrubs <20 cm tall with shrub canopy typically >20% of total vegetation, often with grasses, sedges, herbs, or non-vascular vegetation.

classes.label: Shrub/Scrub
classes.description: Areas dominated by shrubs <5 m tall with shrub canopy typically >20% of total vegetation; includes true shrubs, young trees in early succession, or trees stunted by environmental conditions.

classes.label: Grassland/Herbaceous
classes.description: Areas dominated by graminoid or herbaceous vegetation, generally >80% of total vegetation; not subject to intensive tilling, but can be used for grazing.

classes.label: Sedge/Herbaceous
classes.description: Alaska only: areas dominated by sedges and forbs, generally >80% of total vegetation; may include significant grasses or other grass-like plants (e.g., sedge tundra, sedge tussock tundra).

classes.label: Lichens
classes.description: Alaska only: areas dominated by fruticose or foliose lichens, generally >80% of total vegetation.

classes.label: Moss
classes.description: Alaska only: areas dominated by mosses, generally >80% of total vegetation.

classes.label: Pasture/Hay
classes.description: Areas of grasses, legumes, or grass–legume mixtures planted for livestock grazing or production of seed/hay, typically on a perennial cycle. Vegetation accounts for >20% of total vegetation.

classes.label: Cultivated Crops
classes.description: Areas used for production of annual crops (e.g., corn, soybeans, vegetables, tobacco, cotton) and perennial woody crops (e.g., orchards, vineyards). Crop vegetation >20% of total vegetation; includes all land being actively tilled.

classes.label: Woody Wetlands
classes.description: Areas where forest or shrubland vegetation accounts for >20% of vegetative cover and the soil or substrate is periodically saturated with or covered with water.

classes.label: Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands
classes.description: Areas where perennial herbaceous vegetation accounts for >80% of vegetative cover and the soil or substrate is periodically saturated with or covered with water.
